name: Welcome to Bullet Hell
description:
Welcome to Bullet Hell (not actual bullet hell) is a hard-as-balls top-down shooter with zero lore whatsover. All you need to worry about is the surrounding enemies trying to take your life away from Hell (though it doesn't make much sense if you think about it.

F E A T U R E S

- Simplistic gameplay. The controls are easy to learn but hard to master, creating a level of depth.
- Unlimited ammo. Unlimited ammo, unlimited fun.
- The timeless duo. In Hell, an SMG and a shotgun are your best friends. (and a handful of grenades as well.)
- Variety of enemies. Ranging from your average grunt to a shield-wielding giant that doesn't even touch the shield.
- Random levels. Levels generate randomly to create a fresh experience every time you play.
- Difficulties. You can either play this with bandages around your fingers or if you want the ultimate masochism fuel, you've come to the right place.
- Screenshake. Lots of screenshake.
- Progression. Earn extra health and ammo the further you're invested in the game.
- [F]xecute. A mechanic that allows you to finish low health Grunts and heal for some HP, the more health you're missing the more it heals. Health regeneration is not a thing.
- Blank. Wiping away ALL enemy projectiles on the screen has never been so easy.
- NukEdition. When you want a more explosive approach to the game.
- Toilet humor.

I N S T R U C T I O N S
You are to survive as long as possible whilst racking up the high score. In order to do so effectively, learning the basics of the controls is necessary.
[W][A][S][D] - Movement
Left Click - Fire
Right Click - Blank (goes on a moderate cooldown)
[R] or [Space] - Switch/Reload weapons
[E] - Tap to throw grenades, hold to cook
[F] while having crosshair aimed at a weakened (outlined in red) enemy - [F]xecute
[Esc] - Pause/Unpause
[Backspace] - Leave

Made using Clickteam Fusion 2.5.
